member.name: M:Presentation.Controllers.AdminDashboardController.GetClientsAsync(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Retrieves a list of clients with optional pagination support.
member.remarks: This method provides flexible client retrieval: - When both pageNumber and pageSize are provided: returns paginated results - When either parameter is null: returns all clients without pagination - Invalid values are corrected: pageNumber < 1 becomes 1, pageSize < 1 becomes 10 - The count in response represents the number of clients in the current page/set
member.param: The page number for pagination (optional). If null, all clients are returned. If < 1, set to 1.
The number of items per page (optional). If null, all clients are returned. If < 1, set to 10.
member.returns: Returns a ClientListDTO containing count of returned clients and the client data
member.response: Returns when clients are successfully retrieved with count and data
Returns when unauthorized calls occur
Returns when internal server error occurs during client retrieval

member.name: M:Presentation.Controllers.LoginController.ResetPassword(Shared.DataTransferObject.ClientIdentityDTOs.ResetPasswordDTO)
member.summary: Resets the user's password using a temporary reset token.
member.remarks: This endpoint allows users to reset their password using a valid temporary reset token. The token must be issued within the last 5 minutes and is automatically validated from the Authorization header. The new password must be different from the current password and meet the application's password policy requirements. Upon successful password reset, the temporary token is invalidated and a new authentication token is issued.
member.returns: Returns user details with new authentication token upon successful password reset
member.response: Returns when password is reset successfully with new token
Returns when the reset token is invalid or missing timestamp
Returns when the bearer token is invalid or expired
